revised_title: Simple Electro-Chemical Method for Detecting Metallic Poisons
tldr: Edmund Davy presents a simple electro-chemical method to detect the presence of different metals and minute quantities of metallic poisons. The method uses a Voltaic arrangement with zinc and platina, which deposits the metal in the form of crystals on the negative surface. This method can detect arsenic in very small amounts and outperforms other common tests in some cases.
